intro: Chalcas cammuneng, commonly known as the red-stemmed chalcas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
